intro: Stemonoporus nervosus, commonly known as the veined stemonoporus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in small inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
